endpoints.name: Create Appointment Task

properties.description: The patient for whom the appointment is being requested.
The specialty of the provider that the patient needs to see.
The subspecialty of the provider that the patient needs to see.
The reason for the patient's visit.
The time frame in which the patient needs to have the appointment. This can be in any reasonable format and Ferry will parse it.
The maximum distance (in miles) from the patient's home where the provider can be located.
A list of Provider NPIs to search across. Providing this list will limit the search to just these NPIs.

endpoints.description:
Create an appointment task for a patient.

Once you create a task, Ferry will asynchronously process the task to find providers with validated availability. You can poll for the status of the task with the [Get Appointment Task](/api-reference/appointment-tasks/get-appointment-task) endpoint.

endpoints.name: Get Appointment Task

pathParameters.description: The ID of the task to load.

endpoints.description: Load a task by its ID.

endpoints.name: Cancel Appointment Task

pathParameters.description: The ID of the task to load.

endpoints.description: Cancel a task. This stops Ferry from processing the task.

endpoints.name: Get All Appointment Tasks

queryParameters.description: The size of each page (default 50, maximum 100).
The number page to load, starting at 0.

endpoints.description: Get all appointment task IDs. You can load the details of a task using the [Get Appointment Task](/api-reference/appointment-tasks/get-appointment-task) endpoint.

properties.description: The IDs of the appointment tasks associated with this patient.

The member ID for the patient's insurance.
The IDs of the appointment tasks associated with this patient.

pages/overview.mdx.markdown:
---
title: Ferry Health API
slug: /
hide-nav-links: true
hide-feedback: true
---

The Ferry Health API provides programmatic access to **Appointment Tasks**.
Use the API to:

- Create **Appointment Tasks**
- Load **Appointment Tasks**

## Authentication

To use the Ferry API, you'll need an API key. If you don't have one already, please
reach out to get one: support@ferry.health.

In all API requests, you should provide your token using the `Authorization`
header with the `"Bearer "` prefix:

```json
"Authorization": "Bearer <YOUR TOKEN>"
```

## Appointment Tasks

You can create Appointment Tasks to initiate a search for providers. See the
[`/create-appointment-task` endpoint](api-reference/appointment-tasks/create-appointment-task) for the
available request properties.

When you create an Appointment Task, we will return an `appointmentTaskId`, and Ferry will asynchronously
compile a list of providers with validated availability. You can poll for the status of a task using
the [`/get-appointment-task` endpoint](api-reference/appointment-tasks/get-appointment-task).

Once the task is in the `"AVAILABLE"` state, it will include some appointment availabilities:

```json Available Task
{
  "appointmentTaskId": "ferry.task-appointment.a3327c6c-1cc2-4f56-a137-6c457550a04e",
  "status": "AVAILABLE",
  "patient": {
    "firstName": "Jane",
    "lastName": "Smith",
    "sex": "Female",
    "dateOfBirth": "1980-01-01",
    "homeAddress": "123 Happy Lane, New York, NY 11211",
    "insurancePlan": "Aetna - Managed Choice Open Access",
    "memberId": "123456"
  },
  "results": {
    "appointmentAvailabilities": [
      {
        "provider": {
          "npi": "1234567890",
          "firstName": "Jane",
          "lastName": "Smith"
        },
        "location": {
          "name": "Louisville Health Center",
          "address": "123 Happy Lane, Louisville KY 01234"
        },
        "nextAvailableAppointments": [
          "2024-09-15T12:00:00.000Z",
          "2024-09-18T14:00:00.000Z",
          "2024-09-20T11:45:00.000Z"
        ],
        "availabilityNotes": "Scheduling 2 weeks out",
        "reasonForInclusion": "CLOSEST_LOCATION"
      }
    ]
  }
}
```
